DOC.brief_summary: Treatment of chronic pelvic pain syndrome (CPPS) is challenging for patients and physicians once conventional therapies fail. We hypothesize that combined sono-electro-magnetic therapy can improve refractory CPPS in men. In addition, we postulate that combined sono-electro-magnetic therapy as well as placebo therapy has a significant effect on brain activity detectable by functional MRI.
DOC.brief_title: Combined Sono-electro-magnetic Therapy for Treatment of Refractory Chronic Pelvic Pain Syndrome
DOC.criteria: CPSS III symptomatic >3 months NIHCPSI total score =/>15 NIHCPSI pain =/>8 post void residual >100mL urinary tract infection urethral stricture prostate cancer age <18 years claustrophobia pacemaker, neurostimulator, insulin / pain pump
